#Text=CHAPTER IX

#Text=Realising that she was rapidly losing ground by exercising her advantage over Alfred in the matter of quick retort , Zoie , with her customary cunning , veered round to a more conciliatory tone .
#Text=“ Well , ” she cooed , “ suppose I DID eat lunch with a man ? ”
#Text=“ Ah ! ” shrieked Alfred , as though he had at last run his victim to earth .
#Text=She retreated with her fingers crossed .
#Text=“ I only said suppose , ” she reminded him quickly .
#Text=Then she continued in a tone meant to draw from him his heart 's most secret confidence .
#Text=“ Did n't you ever eat lunch with any woman but me ? ”
#Text=“ Never ! ” answered Alfred firmly .

#Text=There was an unmistakable expression of pleasure on Zoie 's small face , but she forced back the smile that was trying to creep round her lips , and sidled toward Alfred , with eyes properly downcast .
#Text=“ Then I 'm very sorry I did it , ” she said solemnly , “ and I 'll never do it again . ”
#Text=“ So ! ” cried Alfred with renewed indignation .
#Text=“ You admit it ? ”
#Text=“ Just to please you , dear , ” explained Zoie sweetly , as though she were doing him the greatest possible favour .
#Text=“ To please me ? ” gasped Alfred .
#Text=“ Do you suppose it pleases me to know that you are carrying on the moment my back is turned , making a fool of me to my friends ? ”
#Text=“ Your friends ? ” cried Zoie with a sneer .
#Text=This time it was her turn to be angry .
#Text=“ So !
#Text=It 's your FRIENDS that are worrying you ! ”
#Text=In her excitement she tossed Alfred 's now damaged hat into the chair just behind her .
#Text=He was far too overwrought to see it .
#Text=“ I have n't done you any harm , ” she continued wildly .
#Text=“ It 's only what you think your friends think . ”
#Text=“ You have n't done me any harm ? ” repeated Alfred , in her same tragic key , “ Oh no ! Oh no !
#Text=You 've only cheated me out of everything I expected to get out of life !
#Text=That 's all ! ”
#Text=Zoie came to a full stop and waited for him to enumerate the various treasures that he had lost by marrying her .
#Text=He did so .
#Text=“ Before we were married , ” he continued , “ you pretended to adore children .
#Text=You started your humbugging the first day I met you .
#Text=I refer to little Willie Peck . ”
#Text=A hysterical giggle very nearly betrayed her .
#Text=Alfred continued :
#Text=“ I was fool enough to let you know that I admire women who like children .
#Text=From that day until the hour that I led you to the altar , you 'd fondle the ugliest little brats that we met in the street , but the moment you GOT me -- -- ”
#Text=“ Alfred ! ” gasped Zoie .
#Text=This was really going too far .
#Text=“ Yes , I repeat it ! ” shouted Alfred , pounding the table with his fist for emphasis .
#Text=“ The moment you GOT me , you declared that all children were horrid little insects , and that someone ought to sprinkle bug-powder on them . ”
#Text=“ Oh ! ” protested Zoie , shocked less by Alfred 's interpretation of her sentiments , than by the vulgarity with which he expressed them .

#Text=“ On another occasion , ” declared Alfred , now carried away by the recital of his long pent up wrongs , “ you told me that all babies should be put in cages , shipped West , and kept in pens until they got to be of an interesting age .
#Text=' Interesting age ! ' ” he repeated with a sneer , “ meaning old enough to take YOU out to luncheon , I suppose . ”
#Text=“ I never said any such thing , ” objected Zoie .
#Text=“ Well , that was the idea , ” insisted Alfred .
#Text=“ I have n't your glib way of expressing myself . ”
#Text=“ You manage to express yourself very well , ” retorted Zoie .
#Text=“ When you have anything DISAGREEABLE to say .
#Text=As for babies , ” she continued tentatively , “ I think they are all very well in their PLACE , but they were NEVER meant for an APARTMENT . ”
#Text=“ I offered you a house in the country , ” shouted Alfred .
#Text=“ The country ! ” echoed Zoie .
#Text=“ How could I live in the country , with people being murdered in their beds every night ?
#Text=Read the papers . ”
#Text=“ Always an excuse , ” sighed Alfred resignedly .
#Text=“ There always HAS been and there always would be if I 'd stay to listen .
#Text=Well , for once , ” he declared , “ I 'm glad that we have no children .
#Text=If we had , I might feel some obligation to keep up this farce of a marriage .
#Text=As it is , ” he continued , “ YOU are free and I am free . ”
#Text=And with a courtly wave of his arm , he dismissed Zoie and the entire subject , and again he started in pursuit of Mary and his hat .
#Text=“ If it 's your freedom you wish , ” pouted Zoie with an abused air , “ you might have said so in the first place . ”
#Text=Alfred stopped in sheer amazement at the cleverness with which the little minx turned his every statement against him .
#Text=“ It 's not very manly of you , ” she continued , “ to abuse me just because you 've found someone whom you like better . ”
#Text=“ That 's not true , ” protested Alfred hotly , “ and you know it 's not true . ”
#Text=Little did he suspect the trap into which she was leading him .
#Text=“ Then you DON'T love anybody more than you do me ? ” she cried eagerly , and she gazed up at him with adoring eyes .
#Text=“ I did n't say any such thing , ” hedged Alfred .
#Text=“ Then you DO , ” she accused him .
#Text=“ I DON'T , ” he declared in self defence .
#Text=With a cry of joy , she sprang into his arms , clasped her fingers tightly behind his neck , and rained impulsive kisses upon his unsuspecting face .
#Text=For an instant , Alfred looked down at Zoie , undecided whether to strangle her or to return her embraces .

#Text=As usual , his self-respect won the day for him and , with a determined effort , he lifted her high in the air , so that she lost her tenacious hold of him , and sat her down with a thud in the very same chair in which she had lately dropped his hat .

#Text=Having acted with this admirable resolution , he strode majestically toward the inner hall , but before he could reach it , Zoie was again on her feet , in a last vain effort to conciliate him .
#Text=Turning , Alfred caught sight of his poor battered hat .
#Text=This was the final spur to action .
#Text=Snatching it up with one hand , and throwing his latchkey on the table with the other , he made determinedly for the outer door .
